The Centre for Business at George Brown College offers field education and marketing students have access to membership in two Canadian marketing associations, the CMA and IAB, as part of their tuition fees.

CMA Membership benefits include: live and online events with member pricing, professional development opportunities, resources and guides, networking opportunities, and exclusive access to CMA NXT.

IAB Membership benefits include: student volunteer opportunities for marquee events, members-only webinars and podcasts, original Canadian digital marketing research, globally accepted digital ad standards, standardized courses, certification, and custom workshops.

Graduates will be prepared for careers in various sectors such as hospitality, telecommunications and media, not-for-profit, retail, financial services, digital agencies, and advertising agencies. Potential positions may include marketing coordinator, CRM data analyst, automated campaign specialist, CRM marketing specialist, market research analyst, loyalty marketing coordinator, lead generation specialist, customer experience specialist, business analyst, and sales enablement specialist.

The Strategic Relationship Marketing program at George Brown College aligns with in-demand skills in sales and marketing such as customer relationship management (CRM), Salesforce, and Google Analytics. Students can also prepare for Randstad's suggested top in-demand sales and marketing certifications including Salesforce certification, Google Analytics certification, and HubSpot marketing software certification.
